title: Pentagon Speeds Up Tank Timeline for Ukraine but Resists Calls for Jets
description: The U.S. will begin training Ukrainian troops on M1 Abrams tanks in the next few weeks, officials said, and combat-ready tanks could reach the battlefields by the fall.

title: Satellite Images of Sudan Show a Large Food Market Burned in Darfur
description: A Times analysis of satellite imagery shows how a displaced persons camp lost a key source of food and supplies amid a fight for control of the country.

title: Red Cross Expresses Alarm Over Detainee Health at Guantánamo Bay
description: As the prisoners age, their physical and mental health needs are increasingly challenging, the leader of a visiting delegation said.

title: Germany Names Panel to Investigate 1972 Munich Olympics Attack
description: The commission’s creation stems in part from an agreement made last year to reassess German failures in handling the attack by Palestinian militants, which killed 11 Israeli athletes.

title: Alejandro Toledo Returns to Peru Facing Charges in Corruption Case
description: Alejandro Toledo, who ruled Peru two decades ago, will be extradited from the United States. He has been charged in one of Latin America’s biggest corruption  scandals.

title: Canada Lands Volkswagen Battery Plant With Billions in Subsidies
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said the assistance was needed to offset incentives offered by the United States.

title: For Earth Day, 7 Inspiring Reads
description: We picked some of our favorite articles from the Times’s Climate Desk.

title: Pentagon Aid Package to Ukraine Includes Old M21 Anti-Tank Mines
description: The M21 mines do not run afoul of international treaties. But unlike other mines the United States has given to Kyiv, they can be lethal indefinitely.

title: Canadian Suspect in Paris Synagogue Bombing Is Found Guilty
description: The attack killed four and injured dozens. But decades of false leads, a lack of evidence and legal wrangling delayed a trial.

title: A Radical Experiment in Mental Health Care, Tested Over Centuries
description: In the Belgian town of Geel, families have long taken in people with psychiatric conditions. Could this approach work elsewhere?

title: Books You Can Read to Understand What’s Going on in Sudan
description: For a deeper understanding of what’s going on, here’s what to read.

title: Books to Help Understand Sudan
description: For a deeper understanding of what’s going on, here’s what to read.

title: Ukraine’s Allies Are Struggling to Deliver Key Weapons
description: Documents that were among leaked classified military assessments of the war reveal the struggles of Western allies to fulfill their pledged deliveries of tanks and other weapons systems.

title: Using A.I. in Everyday Life
description: People are already adopting the technology.

title: U.S. Says It Will Begin Training Ukraine on Abrams Tanks Within Weeks
description: The 31 M1 Abrams tanks promised by Washington could reach Ukraine by the fall, far sooner than expected, American officials say.

title: Russia Accidentally Bombs Belgorod, Its Own City, Injuring 3
description: A blast in Belgorod, near the Ukrainian border, was the result of “an accidental discharge of aviation ammunition,” Russia’s Defense Ministry said.

title: Sudan Army Chief Commits to Civilian Rule, but Not a Cease-Fire
description: Gunfights in the capital, Khartoum, continued for a seventh day, despite calls for a pause as the Muslim-majority nation marked the end of the holy month of Ramadan.

title: Dominic Raab, U.K. Deputy Prime Minister, Resigns Amid Bullying Scandal
description: The hard-line Brexiteer, one of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s most loyal political allies, was found by an independent inquiry to have mistreated subordinates.

title: Ukrainian officials express frustration at the pace of weapons deliveries.
‘A Quick Death or a Slow Death’: Prisoners Choose War to Get Lifesaving Drugs
description: An estimated 20 percent of Russia prisoner recruits are H.I.V. positive. To some, the front lines seemed less risky than prisons where they said they were denied effective treatments.

title: The Biggest, Darkest Sky in Australia
description: Looking for darkness in Australia’s biggest state.

title: As Gaza Celebrates Eid, a Gift for Women — and a Duty for Men
description: Palestinian Muslims give the eidiya — a gift of money — to female relatives and children on the Eid that marks the end of Ramadan. It is a revered tradition but one that can come with a heavy price.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: The U.S. prepares for a possible evacuation of its embassy in Sudan.

title: $14.8 Million in Gold and Valuables Vanishes From Toronto’s Airport
description: The police appear to know little about how the crime was committed or who is behind the theft.
